data.title: Secluded hotel
data.text: I've stayed at this hotel for one night and that was enough, this hotel is not located there anything that you can walk to. Very very old hotel but very nice friendly staff. Now I see why it was the cheapest hotel available. There is a $15 Resort fee and I have no idea what you would get for that. Limited parking close to the building and if you arrive late you park a great distance in the dark and have to walk. I probably would never stay here again I'd rather sleep in my car

data.title: Sketchy Business Practices
data.text:
Let me preface this by saying that I would give this establishment and it's Front Desk Manager Dwight Spence 0 stars if I was allowed to. Apparently they find it appropriate to charge someone a $250.00 smoking fee out of the blue, for no reason, and have no real explanation why they did so. Luckily, I found the charge on my bank statement, because otherwise there was no warning that it was coming, there was no call or email or anything saying that they were charging me. there was just a random $250.00 charge that popped up.
I was proactive in this matter and immediately called them up, had them explain, and asked to speak with a manager as this was impossible and needed to be rectified. I was given Mr. Spence's phone number and email and I contacted him through both. I called for 3 straight days, left several voicemails, and never heard back. Finally, I wound up in the area again, and stopped by the hotel to discuss this further. There was NO manager on duty, and the place was an absolute mess. It was a circus with no ringleader. Finally, I was able to speak with someone and he assured me that Mr. Spence would be contacted by him personally and I would hear back. Of course, nothing, so I called again...nothing. Several days went by and I filed a dispute with my credit card company. magically I received a short email from Mr. Spence that was in broken English addressing nothing that I had said and repeating that I had a smoking charge etc.
Let me be extremely clear here...I AM NOT A SMOKER, I HAVE NEVER BEEN A SMOKER, and I most certainly would never smoke indoors even if I happened one. I would love to know how my room was apparently so full of smoke, that they had to deep clean it over the course of several days. Umm...what? How is that even possible? Did one of your employees take a smoke break in my room after I checked out at 7 am? Did you take a smoke break in there Mr. Spence? Or is this one of you and your hotel's shady practices just to screw customers out of money? Honestly, none of the above would surprise me at this point.
I travel for a living, and stay in approximately 40 different hotels per year, and I have NEVER, EVER ran into something like this. Not only do they attempt to scam me out of this money, but the manner in which they have handled the situation (mostly ignored it), and simply acting as if they can do whatever they want is as off-putting as I have ever experienced from a business.
I would never stay here again. The lack of organization, leadership, competence, and human decency is incredibly appalling, and it's a shame. Hopefully one day enough 1-star reviews and their F rating from the Better Business Bureau will actually mean something to them enough to make positive changes. Until then, avoid this property at all costs.

data.title: Sawgrass grand hotel
data.text: This hotel was very pleasant, great employees excellent rooms, very clean, not to crowded the bar lacked options although Craig the bartender  definitely made it worth staying and drinking at the hotel. I definitely recommend staying here!

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text:
The rooms were so comfortable... The grounds were well taken care of.
The front desk especially Andrew were the best.  Also the little cafe run by Jose was great and Jose was so nice and personable... we loved every minute of our interaction with him.  
The little Restaurant/buffet  SUCKED... the wait staff was rude.. the food was not great nor was there much selection.  If not for the rest of the staff.. I would have been so unhappy... Otherwise.  
I would stay again.  Just down the street is an amazing Chinese Buffet with seafood, chinese fare, american fare. and the staff was fabulous.
Altogether  great experience.

data.title: Don't be fooled by the pictures
data.text: Customer service here is great. The staff is friendly and helpful, although the front desk is always short staffed. There is no business area for guests. The pool is only open during daylight hours. The "Italian" restaurant is far from italian. Spaghetti and lasagna are the only Italian dishes on the menu and they highly overuse buffalo sauce for the other dishes. Their breakfast is basically a continental buffet and not worth the $12. Eggs were overcooked, no bacon offered, no bagels (but cream cheese) and pancakes were horrible. We ate 2 meals and never stopped there again. There are plenty of great places to eat near the hotel. The rooms are not great/pretty average I guess. The pillows suck. The air conditioner is loud and turns on and off every 5 to 10 minutes. The elevator sounds like it is going to fall apart and is filthy! It needs a good inspection and cleaning. The hotel is 10 miles from the beach. Parking is limited near the door and you can only enter through the front door, although there are other exit points.

data.title: Customer service
data.text: Having traveled across this country and many other parts of the world I am always interested to observe the quality of customer service at the various locations. When you come across excellent people I feel the need to recognize them to all customers.  Mr. Harold Rondan, at The Sawgrass Grand, is an exceptional example of genuine customer care and sincerity. He is a very conscientious person and has the desire to genuinely care for the best interests of the consumer and his property. I observed him from a distance handling frustrated people, phone calls, and other duties with ease and aplomb. Then, as my opportunity to speak with him occurred, I was most impressed by his ability to resolve my issues and go above and beyond with effort. Thank you Mr. Rondan. You are not only an outstanding employee but an outstanding person as well. I will come back to this destination because of you.

data.title: Nice Place
data.text: Upside: Marc at the front desk and young lady that checked me in gave outstanding customer service! Friendly Staff... Clean and spacious room. Beautiful outside. Grounds outside well maintained. Downside: Lobby music very loud. Could have had extra staff at front desk for check in, very crowded when i arrived at 9:30PM... only 1 person and she had to answer the constantly ringing phone too!  No night use of the pool... I was really looking forward to an evening swim after my 5 hour drive to get there.  Overall, I will be back!

owner_response.author: Phil K, Manager at Sawgrass Grand Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Greeting Traveler,
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are very happy to pass your kind words about our staff to the entire team, especially Marc! We are also very pleased you enjoyed our rooms. I have notified the proper management about the concerns of the music and  to have an extra staff member and we are taking to account each item. Thanks again for choosing our hotel as your travel destination and we look forward to welcoming you back to make your stay even better!

Warm Regards,
Phil K 
General Manager
Phil@sawgrassgrand.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disgusting!
data.text: Stayed only one night and for starters check in was horrible, waited for ever, only one agent and he was not very hospitable.  Only one elevator working and that was all the way at the end of the building.  The room was filthy with the rugs stained and disgusting. It looks like they haven't been cleaned in years.  Their was food and stains on the walls. The smell was horrible.  NEVER AGAIN!

owner_response.author: Phil K, Manager at Sawgrass Grand Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Greetings Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. On behalf of the staff, we would like to extend our apologies that we did not meet your expectations during your stay. I can assure you that what you experienced is not indicative with a normal stay at our hotel. I have notified management of your issues and corrective measures were taken. 

We hope for a second chance to prove worthy our name. Thank you again for choosing our hotel as your travel destination. 

Kind regards,
Phil K 
General Manager
Phil@sawgrassgrand.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: No coffee machine? Seriously?
data.text: Not a bad place to stay but also nothing special.....Booked thru a third party and was surprised to find there was a $15.00 daily "resort" fee....Fine but what hotel in this day and age does not provide a coffee machine in the room? I have to go to the lobby to purchase Starbucks? Then why charge me an additional $15.00 per day? My other issue is can you at the very least provide adult size towels? Really great staff of people, nice bar, room clean and bed comfortable....not a bad deal for the price.....

data.title: Nice Hotel, good price.
data.text: Stayed at the Sawgrass Grand Hotel for 2 nights. Hotel staff was very courteous, Room was clean and had comfortable beds. Bathroom was a good size and shower was fine. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

owner_response.author: Phil K, General Manager at Sawgrass Grand Hotel, responded to this review

data.title: 5 day stay....
data.text: Awesome service.  Very accommodating! Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Florida! Loved the rooms - bar and the swimming pool.   Fitness center was a  bonus!  Close to the casinos and the beach!

owner_response.author: Phil K, General Manager at Sawgrass Grand Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

data.title: The Best Bartender Craig
data.text: He was the best part of our stay very entertaining very nice pays great attention to the customer we enjoyed sitting at the bar even though it was hurricane coming he made me feel relaxed great asset to the company

data.title: Sawgrass is my playground
data.text: It's always a must to visit Sawgrass when in the Miami and Fort Lauderdale area. The shop and delivery option is a charm. It's like an activity and adventure in one. I feel like home away from home when at Sawgrass.

data.title: Great Service
data.text: Hotel was very elegant and clean. The Front Desk Clerk ZiBrianna was very Pleasant and friendly She also changed my room with no problem. Great hotel and Great Staff. The room was very clean and comfty. Hotel also has snack bar.

data.title: Best Front Desk and Bartender
data.text: I have to say this hotel has the best Front desk and Bartenders! Front Desk- Harold is super nice. He printed me directions to the best sushi in Fort Lauderdale. He didn't hesitate to help me out. Harold makes you feel at home away from home. Bartender- Craig was a very friendly dude. He made it his issue to greet guest by name, and start a convo with guest. Only place Ill stay in lauderdale!

data.title: Wonderful service
data.text: Our reception at the front desk was friendly and courteous. If not mistaken his name was Kenna. The room was very nice , clean and comfortable. We were not  familiar with the area but felt safe walking to a few places close by. Our experience at the "Sawgrass Grand" was overall great thanks to the staff from front desk to housekeeping but especially Danielle. The breakfast buffet could use some improvement.......but overall great stay

data.title: Sawgrass Grand
data.text: I stayed at the Sawgrass Grand hotel for only 4 days and I just wanted to give a huge shout out and thank you to one of the staff members who made my stay in Florida phenomenal. I was working all weekend and I'm originally from Indiana so it can be very tedious and stressful at times. Well I had the most amazing bartender who definitely made my stay very accommodating and made me feel right at home. I saw him almost every night his name was Craig I think. He was very nice and helped me with any questions I had about the area as well as just making some pleasant small talk. Always being on the road can really make you feel singled out and lonely. Only getting to see my family twice a year if lucky. Getting to talk to someone like Craig was almost refreshing he was very down to earth and easy to talk to. I really appreciated having someone make me feel so welcome when I was so far away from home. The whole staff was really great but he definitely made the stay even better.

owner_response.author: Phil K, Manager at Sawgrass Grand Hotel, responded to this review

Best Regards,

data.title: Great stayed
data.text: Had a great time staying here thanks to Danielle because our day was going really  bad all day missed our first flight and the second one got delayed. Wait nearly four hours for our ride to pick us up from the airport and ride all about looking for a hotel until we came here we weren't going to stay here because of the price was a bit  to high but the service did worth it as soon as we walk in Danielle great us with a smile and made a joke or two with us  because she couldn't really understand us because where from the bahamas and she said we talk to fast but the service was great   so we  stayed. I like to say great job to her for helping us find certain places because we where so lost. so she actually draw out a couple places and help us with directions.  I'll be coming back here any time

data.title: Pretty good for the price
data.text: The hotel could use some improvments on cleanliness.I stayed in a king size bed room on the first floor, the carpet had some stains. But other than that the staff isn't so bad and the rooms are pretty big. Descent room for the price

data.title: Average
data.text: This place is a standard average motel (used to be a Holiday Inn) with a pool and workout area, coffee shop and bar area. The room I received was large but had a cheap feel to it. In no way is this place "grand". They charge a $16 resort fee which is a joke. I got a decent deal on this stay but would not recommend with resort fee.

owner_response.author: Phil K, General Manager at Sawgrass Grand Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Greetings Mordy, 
We wanted to apologize that the hotel service did not meet your expectations. One of the biggest perks we offer besides welcoming staff is the attention we give to our guests and the details in the service and cleaning. I will appreciate if you can share with us some more information such as room number and the dates of stay because i would like to follow up with the team and correct the issues. Thank you again for choosing our hotel as your travel destination and for sharing your experience with us. We are looking forward to welcome you back and make sure that next time we do meet and exceed you expectation.

Best Regards,
Phil K 
Assistant General Manager
Phil@sawgrassgrand.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response
